summary: Mennonites are a group of Christians who started during a big change in religion, called the Radical Reformation. They are named after Menno Simons, a leader from the Netherlands. Mennonites believe in following Jesus' teachings closely, including being peaceful and helping others. They are known for not fighting in wars and for their simple way of life. Some Mennonites use old technology, while others are more modern. There are Mennonites all over the world, with large groups in Canada, the United States, and Africa. They have specific practices like footwashing and a simple ceremony for marriage.
title: Mennonites
